properties.EventDescription: Due to strong winds in the Coastal Otago Region, extra care is required for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles when travelling through the area.
properties.Name: General Warning

properties.EventDescription: Due to strong winds in Hawke's Bay Region, road users are advised to take extra care, especially light or high-sided vehicles.
properties.Name: General Warning

properties.EventDescription: Severe weather is forecast from Sunday night to Tuesday morning with heavy snow likely to disrupt travel in alpine areas and Mackenzie Basin Monday afternoon and night. Plan your journey accordingly.
properties.Name: General Warning

properties.LocationArea: SH 2 Hukanui, at the intersection with Te Awe Awe Road
properties.EventComments: Due to resurfacing works, there will be Stop/Go traffic management in place and access to and from Te Awe Awe road will be closed on Mondays to Saturdays between 6am and 6pm from Monday 29th September to Friday 31st October. Please note the road will be open with a 30 km/h temporary speed restriction over the Labour Weekend Holiday period. Plan your journey accordingly and expect up to 5 minute delays.
properties.AlternativeRoute: For access to and from Te Awe Awe Road, detour via Hamua Hukanui Road.
properties.Name: Road Work: SH 2 Hukanui, at the intersection with Te Awe Awe Road

properties.EventComments: Due to underslip repair and retaining wall construction works, there will Stop/Go traffic management in place 24/7 from Monday 20th October for approximately 8 weeks. Plan your journey accordingly and expect up to 10 minute delays.
properties.Name: Road Work: SH 3 Tongaporutu

properties.LocationArea: SH 6 Makarora, near the Camp Creek
properties.EventComments: Due to a slip, there is a 30km/h temporary speed restriction in place. ,caution is advised along this route
properties.Name: Road Hazard: SH 6 Makarora, near the Camp Creek

properties.LocationArea: SH 94 Cascade Creek to Donne River (Westgate)
properties.EventComments: Open from Te Anau to Cascade Creek. . We are expecting heavy snow overnight which will increase the avalanche hazard. We are aiming for a full road reopening at approx. midday tomorrow (Monday). THIS IS SUBJECT TO SNOW AND SLIP ACTIVITY OVERNIGHT. NOTE: The Hollyford is closed at Marion car park due to storm damage
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 94 Cascade Creek to Donne River (Westgate)

properties.EventComments: Due to rockfall safety works, there will be intermittent holdings of traffic in both directions for up to 10 minutes on weekdays between 8am and 5pm from Tuesday 28th October to Friday 21st November. There will also be 1 hour road closures during times of rock blasting over the works programme. Plan your journey accordingly and expect delays. These works are weather dependent and may be postponed at short notice.
properties.Name: Scheduled Road Work: SH 6 Cromwell to Gibbston (Nevis Bluff)

properties.LocationArea: SH 2 Upper Hutt to Featherston, (Remutaka Hill)
properties.EventComments: Due to strong winds, extra care is required, especially for high sided vehicles and motorcycles.
properties.Name: Road Hazard: SH 2 Upper Hutt to Featherston, (Remutaka Hill)

properties.EventComments: Due to resurfacing work, the road will be closed to traffic from Tuesday 4th November until Friday 7th November nights between 9pm and 5am. The road will reopen nightly at 12am to allow queued traffic through. Plan your journey and expect significant delays whilst these works are underway.
properties.AlternativeRoute:
For light vehicles use SH6 to SH63 to get onto SH7 or the Inland Route 70, south of Kaikoura.
Heavy vehicles should use SH6 to SH63 to get onto SH7.
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 1 Oaro to Conway Flat

properties.LocationArea: SH 6 Owen River, near Coal Creek Bridge
properties.EventComments: Due to maintenance work at this site, there are temporary traffic lights with 30km/h temporary speed restriction in in place. Road users are advised to take extra care along this route.

properties.EventComments: Due to road resilience works, there will be Stop/Go traffic control in place 24/7 from Monday 6th October 2025 to Friday 29th May 2026. properties.Name: Road Work: SH 6  10km west of Murchison (O’Sullivans)

properties.EventComments: Due to pavement repair works, these ramps will be closed on Tuesday 28th October and Thursday 30th October nights between 10pm and 4am and the northbound off-ramp only is closing on Wednesday 29th October night between 10pm and 4am. Please note Takapu Road at the interchange is also closed so access to and from Tawa southbound is also closed on the Tuesday and Thursday nights. Plan your journey allowing extra time for travel. Please note these works may be postponed at short notice.
properties.AlternativeRoute: Northbound to Tawa, detour via Westchester Drive and Middleton Road. Northbound from Tawa, detour via Main Road, Kenepuru Drive and SH59 Mungavin Interchange. Southbound from Tawa, detour via Westchester Drive, Middleton Road and enter SH1 at the Grenada southbound onramp. Southbound to Tawa, Detour via SH59 Mungavin interchange and access Tawa via Porirua/Kenepuru.
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 1 Tawa Northbound On & Off Ramps

properties.EventComments: Asphalt resurfacing is taking place from Tues, 28 Oct to Fri, 31 Oct between 7:00 am and 5:30 pm. A stop/ go operation will be in place on State Highway 2 (Matata Road), and a road closure for the Caverhill Road intersection. A delay of 30 minutes can be expected while the plant and equipment are being moved through the intersection. Speed restrictions will remain in place when the site is unattended. Please drive cautiously and follow the directions of our on-site crew.
properties.AlternativeRoute:
Other vehicles 
Eastbound traffic SH2 (Matata Road), continue straight, left to Manawahe Road (Flax Road), left to CaverhIll Road. Westbound: SH2 (Matata Road), right to Manawahe Road, left to Caverhill Road.

properties.Name: News: South Island Regional and District Council Websites

properties.Content:
FINAL UPDATE THU 17 OCT 2019

Kuaotunu River bridge reopens

Our contractors have done a fantastic job to get the bridge opened ahead of schedule, and more than a week before Labour weekend, despite the heavy rain and strong winds that battered the area earlier this week. Traffic management remains in place, including a 30km/h speed restriction.

Please note that, weather dependent, the bridge will need to close again for the day on Monday (21 Oct) to carry out resurfacing works.

---------------

 

UPDATE TUE 08 OCT 2019

Repairing Kuaotunu bridge to reconnect SH25 

Work to repair the Kuaotunu Bridge on SH25 Coromandel after last month’s storm is progressing well, with the bridge expected to reopen within the next couple of weeks.

The repair team has finished driving the piles on the northern side of the bridge and has switched to the southern side. Once all the piles have been driven they will need to be cut to size and the bridge abutments filled with concrete before work to reinstate the bridge deck can begin.

“We understand that these works are frustrating for local residents and those who travel to the area often, however, our contractors are working as hard as they can to repair the damage as quickly and efficiently as possible,” says Transport Agency Waikato Systems Manager Karen Boyt.  

The Transport Agency has joined together with Thames Coromandel District Council to provide a free shuttle bus service from Kuaotunu to Whitianga every day while the bridge is closed.

The Go Kiwi shuttle departs from outside the Kuaotunu fire station, at 7:30am and 8:30am and then returns from Whitianga at 4:30pm and 5:30pm. From Wednesday 9 October there will also be a lunchtime bus leaving Whitianga at 11.30 and Kuaotunu at 12pm. 

Anyone travelling in the area should check our Journey Planner, www.journeys.nzta.govt.nz or call 0800 44 44 49 before leaving for the most up to date information. 

[image src="/assets/8e66b60fd1/NZTA-3.jpg" id="1023" width="657" height="507" class="leftAlone ss-htmleditorfield-file image" title="NZTA 3"]

[image src="/assets/5b38db22be/nzta-2.jpg" id="1022" width="657" height="586" class="leftAlone ss-htmleditorfield-file image" title="nzta 2"]

 

 ---------------

Following an assessment after recent heavy rain, the SH25 Kuaotunu River bridge has been closed, for around five weeks, to repair weather damage.

We understand the frustration this may cause for those who live in or travel to the area often, however our contractors are working as hard as they can to repair the damage as quickly and efficiently as possible.

During this time detours will be clearly signposted via either SH25A and SH25 or SH25 Thames Coast Road.

 [image src="/assets/dd1a4446a4/Kuaotunu-IMG_STOP.jpg" id="1019" width="251" height="303" class="ss-htmleditorfield-file image right" title="Kuaotunu IMG STOP"]
  • Residents south of Blackjack Road will need to access Kuaotunu from Whitianga.
  • Residents west of the bridge will only have vehicle access from the Coromandel side.
  • Pedestrians will be able to cross the river via a separate, existing walk bridge. 

We hope to have the bridge open again by Labour Weekend, however, this is weather dependant. We will keep the community updated, and thank you for your patience during this time.

 

UPDATE TUE 24 SEP 2019

Repair works to SH25 Kuaotonu River Bridge began on Sunday 22 Sep, following an early morning karakia by local Iwi. Our contractors have started to remove the wooden deck after stripping back the seal layers. The seal and deck have been removed by hand, and efforts made to protect the environment by installing a platform below the deck.

[image src="/assets/b241894b48/Kuaotunu-IMG_6039.jpg" id="1018" width="733" height="550" class="leftAlone ss-htmleditorfield-file image" title="Kuaotunu IMG 6039"]
properties.Name: Road Work: Kuaotunu River Bridge Repairs
